intro: Spigelia texana, commonly known as Texas spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant produces showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Spigelia texana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
